bwwExcerpt: The Second World War rumbles on, overseas and unseen in Charles Fuller's A Soldier's Play, which won the Pulitzer Prize for Drama in 1982. Within the play, another war on bodies and minds-still as corrosive today as it was then-plays out, as the poison of racism and oppression turns both inward and outward on a group of black soldiers. This Roundabout Theatre Production (opening tonight to March 15 at the American Airlines Theatre), almost 40 long years since the play's creation, is also its Bro
